definition: to make into/to change into/-ization/to ... -ize/to transform/abbr. for 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]

sentences.english: Driven by the new technology revolution, economic globalization has picked up speed.
sentences.chinese: 在新技術革命的推動下，經濟全球化進程加快。

sentences.english: Globalization will not self-regulate in ways that ensure fair distribution of benefits.
sentences.chinese: 全球化不會自我調節，確保公平分配利益。

sentences.english: Finally, to seek a corresponding point of the audiences from home and abroad under the globalizational context.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化語境下，尋求中外觀衆審美需求的契合點。

sentences.english: From this viewpoint, globalisation is a kind of phenomenological tool for making sense of the world.
sentences.chinese: 從這個觀點看，全球化是個認識世界現象的邏輯工具。

sentences.english: We are tired of the globalist network of power.
sentences.chinese: 我們厭倦了全球化的權錢網絡。

sentences.english: The HTC team, he brags, is very global.
sentences.chinese: 他聲稱，HTC的團隊是全球化的。

sentences.english: The role of city and city-region in the age of globalization is becoming increasingly important.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化時代，城市和城市地區的重要性日益提升。

sentences.english: Globalisation has made markets more responsive and flexible.
sentences.chinese: 受全球化影響，市場越來越靈活應變。

sentences.english: Globalization is the new frontier in business growth.
sentences.chinese: 全球化是業務增長的新領域。

sentences.english: In the world of globality, you can't wait for someone else to set the rules.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化世界中，你不能等待別人來幫你制定規則。

sentences.english: In South Africa, Global English therefore represents the cultural equivalent of a neutron bomb.
sentences.chinese: 在南非，全球化英語就相當於一顆文化的中子彈。

sentences.english: Globalisation is a catch-all to describe increased international trade.
sentences.chinese: “全球化”是個泛稱，用以描述增進了的的國際貿易。

sentences.english: Under the context of globalization, interculture has been a Key word in literary theory study.
sentences.chinese: 在全球化語境的文論研究中，文化間性已成爲關鍵詞。

sentences.english: Financial empire building drove late twentieth-century globalization.
sentences.chinese: 金融帝國的建立驅動着20世紀後期的全球化。

sentences.english: In an age of globalisation, global powers have to be economic titans.
sentences.chinese: 在一個全球化的時代，世界大國還應是經濟巨人。

sentences.english: It also explains the effects of globalizing forces of post industrial movement of tourism.
sentences.chinese: 這也解釋了全球化力量對旅遊後工業運動的影響。

pinyin: mao4 yi4 bao3 hu4 zhu3 yi4
duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Belt and Road Initiative, Chinese government plan to provide finance and engineering expertise to build infrastructure across Eurasia and northeast Africa, unveiled in 2013
